title: Here’s how marsh grass shrimp reduce drag while swimming
description: The shrimp flexes its legs on the recovery stroke and keeps them close together.

title: OpenAI’s new chatbot can hallucinate a Linux shell—or calling a BBS
description: ChatGPT-generated command line can create virtual files, execute code, play games.

title: Pfizer seeks FDA greenlight for bivalent COVID dose in kids under 5 years
description: Bivalent vaccine wouldn't be a booster, but part of an updated primary series.

title: Syntax errors are the doom of us all, including botnet authors
description: A command typo might have dismantled most of an advanced malware's network.

title: Respiratory illnesses slam US: “Perfect storm for a terrible holiday season”
description: Respiratory illnesses are slamming the US, and things could get worse.

title: Grandmother sues cop who wrongly targeted her home using “Find My” app
description: Denver Police Department vows to train officers on how "Find My" app works.

title: Microsoft games like Starfield will cost $70 starting next year
description: Company says new price ceiling reflects "technical complexity" of major games.

title: Callisto Protocol devs say “damn clerical error” caused PC frame rate issues
description: New patch fixes widespread stuttering caused by "rushed" shader compilation update.

title: After more than 5 years, Nvidia’s GTX 1060 is no longer Steam’s most-used GPU
description: Shortages and price increases have given the GTX 1060 an unusually long life.

title: When HBO Max and Discovery+ merge, they’ll have a new name
description: The more neutral name is intended to protect the premium HBO brand.

title: Cooler Master’s massive workstation pod is an extravagant alternative to desks
description: Cooler Master announces waitlist for long-awaited Orb X.

title: Google kills “Duplex on the Web,” an automated website navigation feature
description: Google wanted to click through websites on your behalf, but did that solve a problem?

title: Former Twitter employees explain why Apple actually paused ads
description: Apple has "fully resumed" Twitter advertising after Musk misunderstanding.

title: Dwarf Fortress’ graphical upgrade provides a new way into a wildly wonky game
description: The cryptic game's new interface welcomes newcomers but preserves the chaos.

title: Dmitry Rogozin may be in some trouble in Russia
description: Wagner Group soldiers are well-trained to identify those attired in NATO clothing.

title: US Forest Service is the latest government agency to try electric trucks
description: By 2027, all light-duty vehicles bought by the federal government must be EVs.

title: After the Artemis I mission’s brilliant success, why is an encore 2 years away?
description: "I would say that we’re going to try our best to get there."

title: DHL is buying 2,000 electric Ford E-Transits as delivery vans
description: The electrified version of Ford's best-selling van is finding new friends.
